title: Charli xcx Unveils โWuthering Heightsโ Tracklist Featuring Surprise Collab With SkyยFerreira

body: Charli xcx has finally shared the full tracklist for her Wuthering Heights soundtrack album, revealing all 12 song titles — including one featuring Sky Ferreira — after attending the film’s premiere on Wednesday (Jan. 28). Related Charli xcx’s ‘Brat’ Era Is a ‘Dead Horse’ She Can’t Stop Beating in ‘Residue’ Video Featuring a Major Celeb Cameo Charli xcx Can’t Break Free From the ‘Chains of Love’ in Stunt-Filled Music Video for ‘Wuthering Heights’ Charli xcx Delivers Second Original ‘Wuthering Heights’ Song for ‘Wild, Sexual, Gothic’ Film’s Trailer In an Instagram post following the Los Angeles premiere of Emerald Fennell’s adaptation of Emily Brontรซ’s famous novel, the British dance-pop star shared a carousel of photos of herself in a gold period gown, walking the red carpet with stars Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi. The final slide is a screenshot of a comment Charli recently left on the Wuthering Heights Letterboxd page, in which she premiered the 12 song names in order. “‘Wuthering Heights’ 13th February <3,&#82โฆ

title: Networks Keeping NASAโs Artemis II Mission Connected
summary: NASAโs Artemis II mission will transport four astronauts around the Moon, bringing the agency one step closer to sending the first astronauts to Mars. Throughout Artemis II, astronaut voice, images, video, and vital mission data must traverse thousands of miles, carried on signals from NASAโs commuโฆ
body: 5 Min Read Networks Keeping NASAโs Artemis II Mission Connected An artist’s conceptual image of network antennas supporting the Orion spacecraft. Credits: NASA / Dave Ryan NASAโs Artemis II mission will transport four astronauts around the Moon, bringing the agency one step closer to sending the first astronauts to Mars. Throughout Artemis II, astronaut voice, images, video, and vital mission data must traverse thousands of miles, carried on signals from NASAโs communications systems. Through Artemis , NASA is establishing an enduring presence in space and exploring more of the Moon than ever before. To achieve this, Artemis missions rely on both the Near Space Network and the Deep Space Network. These networks, with oversight by NASAโs SCaN ( Space Communications and Navigation ) Program office, use global infrastructure and relay satellites to ensure seamless communications and tracking as Orion launches, orbits Earth, travels to the Moon, and returns home. โRobust space communications arenโt optional; theyโre the essential link that unites the crew and the exploration team on Earth to ensure safety and mission success, as I learned firsthand living and working aboard the โฆ
